chunks.cleaned_english_translation: Now more advanced, Secundus succinctly divides the Ogdoad into two Tetrads: right and left, light and darkness. However, he chooses not to derive that leaping and failing power from any of the thirty Aeons, but rather from the fruits that come from their substance.
chunks.original_latin:
Humanior jam Secundus, ut brevior, Ogdoadem
in duas Tetradas dividens, in dextram et sinistram,
in lumen et tenebras; tantum quod desultricem et
defectricem illam virtutem non vult ab aliquo deducere
 triginta  Aeonum, sed a fructibus de substantia
eorum venientibus  .
